snippet: An attempt to repeal a measure to ensure that banks trade their riskiest financial instruments without government protection has drawn bipartisan outrage in Congress.
abstract: Provision in new $1.1 trillion spending bill to roll back regulation that allows banks to trade their riskiest financial instruments without protection of Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation or the Federal Reserve causes bipartisan fury in Congress; so-called 'push-out' provision in Dodd-Frank law was controversial from start.
lead_paragraph: An attempt to repeal a measure to ensure that banks trade their riskiest financial instruments without government protection has drawn bipartisan outrage in Congress.

headline.main: Furor Over Move to Aid Big Banks in Funding Bill
headline.print_headline: Furor Over Move to Aid Big Banks in Funding Bill

keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
